Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base, high shoulder, short inset neck and everted roll rim. Exterior is decorated in red-brown paint with bands composed of four wavy lines applied with a multiple brush. The bands zig-zag around the body running from the neck to a horizontal band that encircles the lower body near the base.
Curator's comments: Shape is similar to 91c in Petrie’s (1953) Corpus of Protodynastic Pottery.
